item.description:
Celebrate our planet's most precious resource this World Water Day, Sunday March 22nd!

The international observance of World Water Day is an initiative that grew out of the 1992 United Nations Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED) in Rio de Janeiro. Countries around the globe are encouraged to implement UN recommendations. The day is a time to celebrate humanity's most essential resource.

Following the walk, we will gather at a local Take Back the Tap restaurant, North Star Cafe, from 4:30-7:30pm. We will offer music, local treats, and a chance to share projects and ideas about our water future in Maine and around the planet.

A letter to governor Baldacci will be available for participants to view and sign. The letter will exhibit a message of solidarity among this diverse group of water-conscious constituents.
We hope that you will join us in the festivities to celebrate our city's clean and reliable public water supply, the municipal employees who work hard to bring us safe water every day, and the surrounding watersheds that sustain our communities in Maine.

Brought to you by-

Maine Water Allies
